template.h1: Craft Your Success with Odoo – A Carpenter's Guide to Custom Tables! 🪚✨
template.p: Hey there, awesome carpenter! 👋 Are you ready to take your custom table business to the next level? With Odoo, you can manage your sales, stock, purchases, and customer contacts all in one place. It might sound overwhelming, but fear not! I’m here to guide you step by step through the magical world of Odoo. So grab your virtual toolbox, and let’s get started! 🚀

Imagine having all your business operations streamlined and organized—sounds dreamy, right? 🌟 With Odoo’s features like Sales Management, Stock Management, and Purchase Management, you’ll not only save time but also enhance customer satisfaction. You’ll be crafting tables and raving reviews at the same time!

template.h3: 1. Set Up Your Account and Access Odoo 🚪

ul.li: Go to the Odoo dashboard.
If you don’t have an account, click on Sign Up and follow the prompts.
Once logged in, explore the apps available for your business!

template.h3: 2. Managing Your Sales with Sale Management 📈
template.p: Your first stop in the Odoo universe is the Sales Management app. This is where the magic begins!

ul.li: Click on the Sales app from your dashboard.
To create a new sale order, click Create.
Fill in the customer details (don’t forget to impress them with your beautiful custom tables!) 🪑
Customize the order with product details, quantity, and price.
Finally, click on Save to keep that order alive! 🎉

template.h3: 3. Stock Management – Keep Your Workshop Organized 📦
template.p: The next stop is Stock Management. You want to know what’s in your workshop at all times. Here’s how:

ul.li: Select the Inventory app.
Check current stock by clicking on Products.
If you need to make adjustments, click on any product, and edit the quantities as necessary.
Don’t forget to regularly check your inventory—it keeps your tools sharp and your business sharp too! ⚒️

template.h3: 4. Purchase Management – When You Need More Supplies! 🛒
template.p: No carpenter can work without wood! Manage your supplies easily:

ul.li: Go to the Purchases app from your dashboard.
Hit Create to start a new purchase order.
Select the supplier and the materials you need (make those tables shine with quality wood!).
Once done, click Confirm and let the supplies roll in! 🌳

template.p: It’s important to keep track of all your customers and suppliers:

ul.li: Access the Contacts app.
Click on Create to add a new contact (and give them a friendly little note about your work!).
Don’t forget to link your customers to their respective sales orders for easy reference.

template.p: Here are some insider tips to enhance your experience with Odoo:

ul.li: Custom Products: Make sure to add your custom tables as products. This will streamline your sales process!
Use Templates: Utilize email templates to welcome new customers or thank them for their orders. Who doesn’t love a personal touch?
Analytics: Regularly check your sales analytics to see what tables are most popular. This helps you focus on the best sellers! 📊

template.p:
Q: Can I track multiple sales orders at once?
A: Absolutely! You can view and manage all your sales orders from the Sales app, allowing you to juggle multiple orders like a pro! 🎪

Q: How do I know when to reorder stock?
A: Set up reordering rules in the Inventory app, and Odoo will remind you when stock is low. Talk about a helpful friend! 🥳
template.h2: How Projects and Tasks Are Automatically Managed for Your Products in Odoo 📊🛠️
template.p: In Odoo, certain service products are designed to trigger automatic project or task management workflows upon sale. This can be incredibly useful for managing time-tracked services like carpentry work, custom-built furniture, or consultancy tasks.
template.h3: What Happens When You Sell These Products? 🔧
template.p: When a product is sold, Odoo can automatically create a project or assign tasks to a global project. Here’s what each product does:
template.h3: 1. Wood Frame and Custom Table – Projects Based on Templates 📋
template.p: These products are linked to a specific project template. When sold, Odoo will:

ul.li: Automatically create a new project.
The new project will be based on the predefined project template, ensuring consistency in tasks and project structure.
You can track time through timesheets and invoice the client based on project completion or milestones.

template.h3: 2. Custom Desk – Tasks in a Global Project 🗂️
template.p: Unlike the Wood Frame and Custom Table, the Custom Desk creates tasks within a pre-existing global project. Here’s how it works:

ul.li: When sold, Odoo will create a new task inside the designated global project.
This task can be tracked through timesheets, allowing you to bill the client for the time spent on each individual task.
Invoicing is done based on delivery, meaning you charge when the task or service is completed.

template.h3: How to Use This in Your Business 🚀
template.p: By selling these services, you’re not just creating revenue but also organizing your work. Odoo handles the back-end project creation and task assignment, saving you time and ensuring each service is tracked effectively.

ul.li: Automation: Automatically create projects or tasks when products are sold.
Consistency: Use templates to ensure your projects follow a standardized structure.
Time Tracking: Easily track the time spent on each project or task through timesheets.
Seamless Invoicing: Bill your clients based on delivery or time spent.

template.p: Odoo’s project and task tracking integration with products allow you to streamline your service-based sales. Whether you're building custom furniture or offering consultancy services, these features ensure efficient project management from the moment a sale is made!
template.h2: Quotation Template Magic: Simplified Roof Project Estimation 🏠✨
template.p: Odoo takes the hassle out of creating quotations for complex projects, like roofing, by allowing you to customize and calculate material needs directly from a quotation template. Here's how you can make the most of it:
template.h3: 1. Automatic Calculations Based on Roof Size 📐🔨
template.p: In the quotation template, you can set up a dynamic system where the customer’s roof size determines the amount of materials needed. The template calculates:

ul.li: The exact quantity of materials required based on roof dimensions (tiles, beams, insulation, etc.).
You can also input your desired margin on these materials directly within the quotation, ensuring that your costs are covered and profits are built in automatically.
This flexibility allows you to create as many variations or amounts as needed for different customers and roof sizes.

template.p: If you want to present a cleaner, more summarized quotation to your customers, Odoo has the perfect solution. By clicking on Simplified Quotation in the quotation template, you can:

ul.li: Hide all the sales order (SO) lines for a more streamlined look.
If sections are included, they will summarize the hidden SO lines under each section for clarity.
If no SO lines are present, the section will default to displaying the project name specified for the quotation, giving your customer a clear overview.
Efficiency: Automatic material calculations based on size save time and reduce errors.
Flexibility: You can adjust margins easily and create custom quotations for different project sizes.
Presentation: Choose between a detailed or simplified quotation view to match your customer’s preferences.

template.p: With Odoo’s powerful quotation template features, you can offer your customers a tailored, professional, and clear quotation experience. Whether you're calculating materials for a roofing project or simplifying your sales orders, these tools are designed to make your business run smoother and more efficiently.

And there you have it! You're now equipped to handle Odoo with confidence and style! 🎉 Go ahead, keep crafting those beautiful tables and watch your business flourish.
